info.description: API for managing configurations and Qdrant vector collections
info.title: Gecko API

get.description: Retrieve a list of all available configurations

put.description: Replaces or updates the configuration items for a given config ID

get.description: Checks the database connection and returns the server status
Returns information about a collection by name

put.description: Create a Qdrant collection with vector configuration

delete.description: Deletes a collection and all its points

patch.description: Updates an existing collection by name

put.description: Inserts new points or updates existing ones

post.description: Deletes points in a collection based on filter or IDs
Executes a kNN or recommendation query against a Qdrant collection

get.description: Returns a single point (with vectors and payload) by ID

vector_name.description: This comes from the collection when it is created

adapter.QueryPointsRequest.description: Request body for querying points in a Qdrant collection

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return

lookup_id.description: LookupID is for single-ID recommendation (backward compatible)

positives.description: Positives and Negatives for multi-ID recommendation

query.description: Query is for standard kNN search (vector input)

vector_name.description: Name of the vector to search

with_payload.description: Whether to return payload with results

with_vector.description: Whether to include vector values in results

on_disk_payload.description: If true - point's payload will not be stored in memory

read_fan_out_factor.description: Fan-out every read request to these many additional remote nodes (and return first available response)

replication_factor.description: Number of replicas of each shard that network tries to maintain

write_consistency_factor.description: How many replicas should apply the operation for us to consider it successful

ef_construct.description: Number of neighbours to consider during the index building. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more time required to build the index.

full_scan_threshold.description:
Minimal size (in KiloBytes) of vectors for additional payload-based indexing.
If the payload chunk is smaller than `full_scan_threshold` additional indexing won't be used -
in this case full-scan search should be preferred by query planner and additional indexing is not required.
Note: 1 Kb = 1 vector of size 256

m.description: Number of edges per node in the index graph. Larger the value - more accurate the search, more space required.

max_indexing_threads.description:
Number of parallel threads used for background index building.
If 0 - automatically select from 8 to 16.
Best to keep between 8 and 16 to prevent likelihood of building broken/inefficient HNSW graphs.
On small CPUs, less threads are used.

on_disk.description: Store HNSW index on disk. If set to false, the index will be stored in RAM.

payload_m.description: Number of additional payload-aware links per node in the index graph. If not set - regular M parameter will be used.

variant.description:
Types that are assignable to Variant:

	*MaxOptimizationThreads_Value
	*MaxOptimizationThreads_Setting_

default_segment_number.description:
Target amount of segments the optimizer will try to keep.
Real amount of segments may vary depending on multiple parameters:

- Amount of stored points.
- Current write RPS.

It is recommended to select the default number of segments as a factor of the number of search threads,
so that each segment would be handled evenly by one of the threads.

deleted_threshold.description: The minimal fraction of deleted vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

indexing_threshold.description:
Maximum size (in kilobytes) of vectors allowed for plain index, exceeding this threshold will enable vector indexing

Default value is 20,000, based on <https://github.com/google-research/google-research/blob/master/scann/docs/algorithms.md>.

To disable vector indexing, set to `0`.

Note: 1kB = 1 vector of size 256.

max_optimization_threads.description:
Max number of threads (jobs) for running optimizations per shard.
Note: each optimization job will also use `max_indexing_threads` threads by itself for index building.
If "auto" - have no limit and choose dynamically to saturate CPU.
If 0 - no optimization threads, optimizations will be disabled.

max_segment_size.description:
Deprecated:

Do not create segments larger this size (in kilobytes).
Large segments might require disproportionately long indexation times,
therefore it makes sense to limit the size of segments.

If indexing speed is more important - make this parameter lower.
If search speed is more important - make this parameter higher.
Note: 1Kb = 1 vector of size 256
If not set, will be automatically selected considering the number of available CPUs.

memmap_threshold.description:
Maximum size (in kilobytes) of vectors to store in-memory per segment.
Segments larger than this threshold will be stored as read-only memmapped file.

Memmap storage is disabled by default, to enable it, set this threshold to a reasonable value.

To disable memmap storage, set this to `0`.

Note: 1Kb = 1 vector of size 256

vacuum_min_vector_number.description: The minimal number of vectors in a segment, required to perform segment optimization

quantization.description:
Types that are assignable to Quantization:

	*QuantizationConfigDiff_Scalar
	*QuantizationConfigDiff_Product
	*QuantizationConfigDiff_Disabled
	*QuantizationConfigDiff_Binary

datatype.description: Datatype used to store weights in the index.

full_scan_threshold.description:
Prefer a full scan search upto (excluding) this number of vectors.
Note: this is number of vectors, not KiloBytes.

on_disk.description: Store inverted index on disk. If set to false, the index will be stored in RAM.

modifier.description: If set - apply modifier to the vector values

read_rate_limit.description: Max number of read operations per minute per replica

write_rate_limit.description: Max number of write operations per minute per replica

hnsw_config.description: New HNSW parameters for the collection index

optimizers_config.description: New configuration parameters for the collection. This operation is blocking, it will only proceed once all current optimizations are complete

params.description: New configuration parameters for the collection

timeout.description: Wait timeout for operation commit in seconds if blocking, if not specified - default value will be supplied

config.description:
Types that are assignable to Config:

	*VectorsConfigDiff_Params
	*VectorsConfigDiff_ParamsMap
